intro: Hieracium pseudoeversianum, commonly known as the false hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. Hieracium pseudoeversianum is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain regions.
